title: Kyle Sandilands reveals the full extent of his health issues
text:
He's the honest radio host who has been open about his health issues over the years.

And now Kyle Sandilands has discussed how ditching junk food, cutting out alcohol and halting drug use has helped to save his life, in a candid interview with The Daily Telegraph.

The candid 48-year-old - who previously opened up about his past addiction to cocaine - admitted: 'Now, if I did one line, I'd be dead in five seconds'.

Open and honest: Candid radio host Kyle Sandilands (pictured) has opened up about his health battles over the years, and why he had to change his lifestyle for the better

He added: 'I was like a teenage boy my entire life, and that caught up with me... so that had to get sorted out.'

Kyle confessed he would take cocaine and marijuana 'on and off' over the years, but he's now completely cut them out of his life - as well as alcohol and sugary junk food.

'I've still got high blood pressure and I'm still on medication like a mess,' he added.

Kyle Sandilands has dropped 'three belt sizes' since going on a diet last year, after revealing that his 'teenage boy' lifestyle had caught up with him

The Kyle and Jackie O Show presenter says he now heads to bed at 8:30pm, and has learned to enjoy a healthy diet.

He's done so well, in fact, that he's been able to drop three belt sizes over the past year.

Kyle previously opened up to Daily Mail Australia about his weight loss, saying people are 'surprised' with the transformation when they see him.

'I was grossly overweight and it was making me sick' Kyle (pictured on The Kyle and Jackie O Show) opened up about his weight loss in an interview with Daily Mail Australia

'I was eating s**t before and I'm so stubborn that I never wanted to listen when people told me to get in shape,' he explained.

'I was grossly overweight and it was making me sick.

'My health is so much better now.'
description: He's the honest radio host who has been open about his health issues over the years.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
